job.title: Senior Electrical Engineer (Hospital/Laboratory Facilities)
job.description: ATS Job ID- R118184, Job Location- US-VA-CentrevilleMinimum Clearance Required To StartNot Applicable/NoneJob DescriptionParsons is an industry leader in delivering technology driven solutions to promote safer, healthier and sustainable world class infrastructure to communities throughout the world. Our landmark projects and capital improvement programs support global initiatives in healthcare, infrastructure, water, energy, power, renewables, environmental, and education. We are hiring colleagues with an entrepreneurial spirit who thrive on professional challenges in a high energy environment.We are hiring Senior Electrical Engineers with hospital/laboratory facility condition assessment and design experience. In this role, you will put your electrical power distribution, lighting, communications, and instrumentation systems and equipment survey, assessment, and design experience to good use for our clients, making design, performance, repair, and replacement recommendations that improve healthcare environments.As a Senior Electrical Engineer, you will perform onsite inspections of existing hospital and laboratory facilities and compose detailed narrative reports on the engineering systems and provide conceptual design for recommended new construction and system replacement projects. In addition, you will use Parsons and other client-directed online tools to record information and produce cost estimates for the proposed projects. Responsibilities will include working on professional teams to perform facility assessments and provide consulting support for infrastructure master planning assignments.Key ResponsibilitiesConduct onsite inspections of electrical systems and equipment, as well as review electrical design drawings, electrical equipment specifications, calculations, and other documents for both large and small assessment projects.Assess existing electrical systems and equipment for safety, condition, age, capacity, and design compliance with applicable standards, codes, and regulations.Plan, direct, and supervise the assessment work of other engineers and architects.Assist with preparing client presentations and proposal responses.RequirementsSuccessful candidates will have a strong familiarity with:AIA Guidelines for Design and Construction of Healthcare FacilitiesNFPA 99 Standard for Healthcare FacilitiesNFPA 70 National Electrical CodeNFPA 110 Standard for Emergency and Standby Power SystemsUL 1069 Standard for Hospital Signaling and Nurse Call EquipmentJoint Commission StandardsOSHPD/Title 24RSMeans CostWorks Estimating ToolAutodesk Revit BIM software and unified modeling environmentSuccessful Candidates Must Also HaveWillingness to travel to client offices and jobsites is expected as well as the ability to perform site and facility walk downs as required to conduct condition assessments.Strong written and verbal communication skills.Required Education/ Professional RegistrationBS in Electrical EngineeringRegistered Engineer with 10+ years of post-graduate professional electrical engineering and design experience for hospitals and laboratory facilities.
